availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
To the Sheriff of Barren County Presiding

We command you that of the estate of Wm H Roberts & Drury Roberts, late of your bailiwick, you cause to be made the Sum of One Hundred Dollars with interest at the rate of Six per centure per annu, from the day of 186 until paid which the Commonwealth of Kentucky late in our Green Circuit Court has reconvened against them for forfeited Bail also $350 which in the Same court was adjudged to her for her costs in that behalf expended, whereof the said Defendants are convicted as appears to us of second, & that you have the Said Sums of money before the Judge of said court, at the Court house on the 4th Monday in January next to Render to the said Plaintiff her Debt & costs aforesaid & leave them there this writ

p.note:
Duplicate of the original
John W Barnet

body.p:
Witness Saml. T. Wilson clerk of said court at the Court House aforesaid, this 8th Day of Decr. 1863 and in the year of the Commonwealth.
S T Wilson clk.

Commonwealth
vs } Fifa
W. H. & D Roberts
Jany Rules 1864

Came to hand 11 o'ck A M.
Decr 23d 1863
John N Barnet Defen
S. R. Tolle S. B. C
